title: CME Futures Over Labor Day Weekend
text:
Futures will be trading Sun 5:00 PM Central to Mon 12:00 Noon Central.

Then again Mon 5:00 PM Central - to normal schedule.

Although you may not trade futures without a futures account, chances are your fund managers are trading them.

Monday is a holiday only in the US and Canada. The rest of the world will be open for business.

Check future quotes at https://www.cmegroup.com/

Or, https://www.cnbc.com/pre-markets/

Stock futures opened sharply down [will check the news*] while gold futures are up.

* Don't see any. There is hurricane Dorian news, Brexit chaos, the previously announced tariffs on China kick in today and the negative tone of the current Barron's, but those don't explain a big down opening for stock futures.

YBB
description: Futures will be trading Sun 5:00 PM Central to Mon 12:00 Noon Central. Then again Mon 5:00 PM Central - to normal schedule. Although you may not trade - 20547
